info.headline: Severe Weather Statement issued May 01 at 8:27PM EDT until May 01 at 9:15PM EDT by NWS Pittsburgh
info.description: ...A SEVERE THUNDERSTORM WARNING REMAINS IN EFFECT UNTIL 900 PM EDT FOR NORTHEASTERN MERCER AND NORTHERN VENANGO COUNTIES... At 827 PM EDT, a severe thunderstorm was located 9 miles northwest of Franklin, moving northeast at 35 mph. HAZARD...60 mph wind gusts and quarter size hail. SOURCE...Radar indicated. IMPACT...Minor hail damage to vehicles is possible. Expect wind damage to trees and power lines, resulting in some power outages. Locations impacted include... Oil City, Franklin, Sugarcreek, Hasson Heights, Polk, Sandy Lake, Rouseville, Cooperstown, Pleasantville, Utica, New Lebanon, and Maurice K Goddard State Park. HAIL THREAT...OBSERVED MAX HAIL SIZE...1.00 IN WIND THREAT...RADAR INDICATED MAX WIND GUST...60 MPH
info.instruction: For your protection move to an interior room on the lowest floor of a building. Please report severe weather by calling 412-262-1988, posting to the NWS Pittsburgh Facebook page, or using Twitter @NWSPITTSBURGH.
